title: Problems building HDF5 with Intel OpenMPI
body:
Is anyone else have trouble building HDF5 with Intel and OpenMPI? It works fine outside of Spack but with Spack it crashes during make. It also works with Spack with any other compiler or any other MPI library, just not Intel and OpenMPI. Here is the configuration I'm using:

```
spack install hdf5 %intel +szip -cxx +mpi ^openmpi+tm+psm
```

The Intel compiler is 16.0.1, OpenMPI 1.10.2, and HDF5 1.10.0 (although I think this problem still occurred with the previous HDF5 version).

When built outside of Spack, everything looks good:

```
checking for Fortran INTEGER KINDs... {1,2,4,8}
checking for Fortran REAL KINDs... {4,8,16}
checking for Fortran REALs maximum decimal precision... 34
checking sizeof of native KINDS...
checking for Fortran INTEGER KINDs... {1,2,4,8}
checking for Fortran REAL KINDs... {4,8,16}
checking for Fortran REALs maximum decimal precision... 34
checking sizeof of available INTEGER KINDs... {1,2,4,8}
checking sizeof of available REAL KINDs... {4,8,16}
checking if Fortran compiler supports intrinsic C_LONG_DOUBLE... yes
checking if Fortran C_LONG_DOUBLE is different from C_DOUBLE... yes
checking for Fortran interoperable KINDS with C... {4,8,16}
```

When built with Spack, I'm seeing the following warning message during configure:

```
Error
configure: WARNING: Failed to run program to determine available KINDs
checking sizeof of native KINDS... configure: WARNING: Fortran program fails to build or run!

Error
configure: WARNING: Failed to run program to determine available KINDs
checking sizeof of available INTEGER KINDs... {}
checking sizeof of available REAL KINDs... {}
checking if Fortran compiler supports intrinsic C_LONG_DOUBLE... yes
checking if Fortran C_LONG_DOUBLE is different from C_DOUBLE... yes
configure: WARNING:
           Fortran REAL(KIND=) is  Bytes, but no corresponding C float type exists of that size
                     !!! Fortran interfaces will not be generated for REAL(KIND=) !!!

checking for Fortran interoperable KINDS with C...
```

This eventually leads to errors in make:

```
H5match_types.c(155): error: expected an expression
    int IntKinds[] = H5_FORTRAN_INTEGER_KINDS;
                                             ^
```
